cause.description:
FOX, "American Idol" and CPEF created a two night special on 24 and 25 April to help raise awareness and funds for U.S. organizations focused on delivering health and education resources for children and young people in extreme poverty in the U.S. and Africa.
On 24 April the top 6 finalists sang songs that can be considered "Life Anthems." In keeping with the "Idol Gives Back" theme, all the songs performed were about compassion and hope. After the performance show, viewers voted for their favorite contestants via toll-free numbers and text-messages, as usual. On this special night, however, viewers also helped change the lives of the truly needy. For every vote cast, "American Idol" sponsors Coca Cola and AT&T, along with a range of sponsors and partners, donated money to CPEF.
1. Raising awareness of poverty conditions and the issues facing the poor and disadvantaged in the United States and throughout the world, particularly in Africa.
2. Developing and distributing educational tools and initiatives for school children and teachers to understand how poverty is perpetuated and the steps that can be taken to eradicate it.
